sentences.sContent: They may pay a high price for their few years of glory.
sentences.sCn: 为了短短几年的辉煌，他们也许要付出高昂的代价。

sentences.sContent: ...My books are 80% new and are to be sold at half the price of a new set...
...They say it is healthier than green tea and could be sold for a price that is three to four times higher than the price of green tea...
...half the usual price and it’s very tasty...
...Kibara says he has not received a higher price for his purple tea crop...
...He says the market for the tea is unstable and he is often forced to sell his purple tea for the same price as green tea leaves...
...taxing and prohibiting special price deals for junk foods...
...when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession...
...The price of professional childcare has been rising since the 1980s...
...the price of care averaged more than $16...
...the price of care averaged less than $5...

phrases.pCn: 竞争价格；公开招标价格
股票价格；股票行市；交易所卖价
在价格上；在价格方面；就价格而言
以很高的代价；以较高的价格
adj. 以……的价格；以……的代价

words.tran: 无价的；极贵重的；非常有趣的

trans.tranOther: the amount of money you have to pay for something
